Machine Learning and AI Projects

Breast Cancer Diagnosis Using Machine Learning

This project focuses on predicting breast cancer diagnoses using machine learning models. By leveraging the Breast Cancer Wisconsin (Diagnostic) Dataset, the aim is to accurately classify tumors as malignant or benign.

Using Machine Learning Techniques

We utilized various machine learning techniques, including:

  • Random Forest.
  • Gradient Boosting.
  • Partial Least Squares regression.
  • Neural Networks.

This project involves building a machine learning model to predict breast cancer. The stages of the project are described below:

Data Preprocessing

This stage involves cleaning and preprocessing the data. The steps include handling missing values, encoding categorical variables, scaling features, and splitting the data into training and testing sets.

Feature Engineering

In this stage, new features are created and the most important ones are selected. This involves techniques such as feature transformation, interaction terms creation, and dimensionality reduction to improve model performance.

Model Training

Various machine learning models are trained and hyperparameters are tuned during this stage.

Model Evaluation

The performance of the trained models is evaluated using various metrics. This includes accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score, ROC AUC, and confusion matrix analysis. The goal is to assess the models' effectiveness in predicting breast cancer.

Key Findings

Our analysis demonstrated that the Neural Network model achieved the highest accuracy, precision, and F1 score, making it the best-performing model. The Random Forest and PLS models also showed strong performance, while Gradient Boosting provided good predictive power.

Model Accuracy Precision Recall F1 Score ROC AUC
Random Forest 0.964912 0.953488 0.953488 0.953488 0.997707
Gradient Boosting 0.947368 0.930233 0.930233 0.930233 0.995414
PLS Regression 0.973684 0.976190 0.953488 0.964706 0.994759
Neural Network 0.991228 1.000000 0.976744 0.988235 0.988863

Impact on Breast Cancer Diagnosis

The insights from these models can aid in the early detection and diagnosis of breast cancer, potentially improving patient outcomes through timely and accurate predictions.
